result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew A. Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA/Treatment and any other counseling/treatment per agent.  To continue with medication-assisted treatment or durg court at the discretion of the agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
DNA sample to be provided.  5 days sentence credit only if probation is revoked.  All fines/costs/surcharges to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew A. Lee in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Masana states matter is resolved and DE also needs to do a waiver of prelim as well.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  State files information.  Atty Masana acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and states DE will be pleading NC to Ct 1 as charged.  Cts 2 and 3 to be dismissed/read-in.  State states agreement.  Atty Masana agrees.  Court makes suggestion re: medication assisted treatment.  Parties agree w/suggestion by Court.  Atty Masana enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Masana makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC
3 years probation
Conditions of probation:
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office today or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/treatment and any other counseling/treatment per agent
Continue w/medication assisted treatment or drug court at the discretion of the agent
Cash bond to be applied
5 days sentence credit if probation should be revoked
DE to report to P&P no later than noon on 4/7/2016
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 3:  Dismissed/read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 03-04-2016 09:00 am.
Return date at 03-15-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew A. Lee in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. needs discovery and PTC.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew A. Lee

Prior: 535 1/2 5th Ave, Baraboo, WI 53913

Pre-trial conference at 01-29-2016 09:30 am.
Return date at 02-11-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew A. Lee appeared by video means with Attorney Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. State request $2000.00 cash bond.  States warrant and criminal history.  Attorney Tsai request smaller cash bond.  Defendant was previously represented by PD office.  Time limits waived.  $750.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety and may not possess any controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
